page.title: 01 OUR AREA
page.content: Our area consists of the village of Swyddffynnon and includes part of the famous nature reserve _ "Cors Caron," visited by hundreds of naturalists from all over the globe annually.Swyddffynnon itself is a small,rural village,comprising of 24 houses.We have the local primary school based here.Swyddffynnon got its name from the Cistercian monks based at Strata Florida Abbey,4 miles away,during the twelfth century.SWYDD stands for OFFICE, and FFYNNON for WELL.According to legend the monks used to have an office by the well in the village. The area itself is sparsely populated,comprising of farms and under nourished land. Agriculture is the main form of employment,and sheep together with cattle the main source of income.The river Camddwr runs through the village
